Articles.Content: What sites do you use to share craft files? I've got an Apollo style Minmus lander that I made in my career game that I'd like to share, but I don't know where I can host the .craft file.

I usually use Mediafire to host my crafts. It's free and is allowed as there is no advertising. To show off your craft simply post your craft file and pictures/videos/instructions in the Spacecraft Exchange section of this forum.

[KerbalX.com](http://kerbalx.com)

You can put pics, videos and text along with the craft and the site will automatically produce lists of the mods that your craft uses and full part list. You can also set what action groups do if you want (or if you use the B9-info drive it will read the info out of that).

You can also search for craft by things like part-count, what mods craft use, if they have science parts, KSP version....it's totally geared towards KSP.

I third this.

As the craftfiles only consist text, you can easily put them on pastebin and People can copy the text to create their own craftfile.

You could even put the text directly into your post, but please use a ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)

Just find a random file hosting site without an account (such as filedropper), there's a lot of them out there ![:wink:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
